0:
--------------------
Text: Because of the obscurity of the name Perseus and the legendary character of its bearer, most etymologists presume that it might be pre-Greek; however, the name of Perseus’ native city was Greek and so were the names of his wife and relatives.
Triplets:<Perseus
1:
--------------------
Text: Perseus:  There is some idea that it descended into Greek from the Proto-Indo-European language.
Triplets:<Perseus
2:
--------------------
Text: Perseus:  In that regard Robert Graves has proposed the only Greek derivation available.
Triplets:<Perseus
